zara.intro: {{name}} is a vibrant AI inspired by South African ubuntu philosophy (‚ÄúI am because we are‚Äù). With a knack for weaving compelling narratives, she helps players understand complex issues like poverty (SDG 1) and inequality (SDG 10) through human-centered stories. Her systems thinking guides teams as they map community dynamics and design inclusive solutions, often using African wildlife metaphors to explain interconnected ecosystems.

arjun.intro: {{name}} is modeled after India's vibrant tech and social entrepreneurship scene and thrives on finding solutions with limited resources. His data-analysis skills help players tackle clean water (SDG 6) or education gaps (SDG 4), while his ‚Äújugaad‚Äù (frugal innovation) spirit inspires creative, low-cost pilots for sustainable infrastructure. His curiosity drives teams to ask ‚Äúwhy,‚Äù bridge cultures, and stay engaged with witty humor.

sofia.intro: {{name}} draws on Colombia‚Äôs peacebuilding and biodiversity movements to advocate fiercely for sustainable development. She guides teams through conflict resolution, stakeholder alignment, and climate action (SDGs 13 & 16) with participatory design and community stewardship. Her resilience, shaped by Latin America‚Äôs history of overcoming adversity, motivates players to persevere through tough challenges.

li.intro: {{name}} is rooted in China‚Äôs rapid urbanization and technological ambition. A strategic thinker, he helps players design scalable solutions for sustainable cities (SDG 11) and industry innovation (SDG 9), blending AI and renewable-energy insights with long-term forecasting. His disciplined optimism, often quoting classical proverbs, nudges teams to think big.

amina.intro: {{name}} draws from Morocco‚Äôs rich cultural tapestry to emphasize inclusion and equity. Her cross-cultural communication skills help players navigate diverse perspectives for global challenges like gender equality (SDG 5) and climate resilience (SDG 13). She balances heritage preservation with progress, translating complex issues through calming stories inspired by Moroccan souks.

elena.intro: {{name}} reflects Ukraine‚Äôs resilience and innovation under pressure. She excels at crisis management for urgent issues such as hunger (SDG 2) or health emergencies (SDG 3), guiding teams to prioritize and act quickly. Her renewable-energy expertise supports clean grids (SDG 7), and her adaptive leadership encourages teams to pivot while keeping morale high with pragmatic humor.

tane.intro: {{name}} grounds problem-solving in MƒÅori wisdom and New Zealand‚Äôs sustainability ethos. He helps players honor land and ocean ecosystems (SDGs 14 & 15) and design circular-economy systems for zero waste. His storytelling sparks creativity, and his respect for nature builds trust with teams seeking meaningful, lasting impact.

marie.intro: {{name}} is a Polish physicist and chemist who revolutionized medicine and radiology through pioneering research on radioactivity.

rachel.intro: {{name}} is an American marine biologist, writer, and conservationist whose work galvanized modern environmental awareness and protection.

bucky.intro: {{name}} was described as an architect, engineer, designer, cartographer, geometer, philosopher, poet, inventor, author, global thinker, and humanist. Marshall McLuhan called him ‚Äúthe Leonardo da Vinci of the 20th century.‚Äù Trained as a naval officer, he believed design and technology could continually do more with less so everyone could thrive. He developed the geodesic dome, coined ‚ÄúSpaceship Earth,‚Äù and envisioned a World Game that empowered everyone to solve global problems. NewWorld Game is inspired by his pioneering work. For more information see here.

intro.paragraph1: The NewWorld Game is a platform, an AI-empowered work- and learning-space, for discovery and developing solutions to real-world problems‚Äîand getting those solutions implemented.
intro.paragraph2: Its goal is to have real impact‚Äîto change the world‚Äîby providing you and your students with space and tools for developing solutions to the problems and issues you care about.

intro.heading: Welcome to the NewWorld Game.
intro.paragraph1: The NewWorld Game is a game like you have never played before. Yes, there are some rules (including think outside the box), goals and winning conditions (most set by the players), challenges (real-world problems), outcomes (impacts in the real world), interaction, and fun. NewWorld Game platform is a work- and play-space, for discovery and developing solutions to real-world problems‚Äîand getting those solutions implemented. Its goal is to have real impact‚Äîto change the world‚Äîby providing you and millions of other like-minded creative individuals with space and tools for developing solutions to the problem and issues about which you care. It is a place that focuses your creativity, experience, values, and perspective on problems and issues that matter‚Äîand provides you a set of tools, and how to use them, that lead to new paths of action and impact‚Äîto strategic designs, plans, and solutions that are viable, regenerative, inclusive, resilient, and cost-effective‚Äîand that get implemented. That it is also fun, helps.
intro.paragraph2: The NewWorld Game‚Äôs name draws on its history as being a direct descendant and outgrowth of the original World Game that was inspired by and based on the work and vision of Buckminster Fuller. Its developers worked with Fuller on the first iterations of the World Game. It points to the need for a new world, one that not only replaces the old world, but makes new options and solutions that engender new possibilities for everyone. The NewWorld Game does this by empowering you with ways of developing new options for a better future that works for all life on Earth, not just those with large quantities of money and the delusion of thinking they are in control.
intro.figureCaption: Medard Gabel and children prepare for World Game Presentation on the world‚Äôs largest world map.

sections.ideasHeading: Turn Your Ideas into Real Solutions
sections.partsText: The NewWorld Game (NWG) takes technological advancements of the 21st century and creatively couples them with the design science engine that was used to play the original World Game ‚Äúlonghand‚Äù in the month-long World Game workshops and shorter in-person and online Global Solutions Labs. It couples an easy-to-use interface with AI, an empowered methodology for developing real-world solutions, comprehensive world statistical resources, solution libraries, and a community of problem solvers. It builds and leverages the power of a diverse, collaborative, cross-cultural, multi-disciplinary, and intergenerational global community with linkages to real organizations implementing solutions.
sections.roleText:
Your role, and challenge, in the NewWorld Game is to develop solutions to global and local problems. You also have a critical role to play in making other teams‚Äô solutions better. You will be chosen, at random, to be an Evaluator of other strategies. Here you will have the opportunity to learn what other teams are doing and help make their work better. You win (we all win) when your solution gets through the Peer Review process and enters the NewWorld Tournament and is added to the NewWorld Solutions Library.

Ideally, you develop your solution as part of a team, but it is possible to play the NewWorld Game alone. The fact that you are here is important. On several levels‚Äîfor the world, for you, and for the community you will be a part of as you work together on what you care about. Thank you.
